channel.title: Homes on Rola Dali
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Rola Dali

item.title: Biography
item.description:
I am a Software Developer and Data Scientist at C3G, probing questions related to human health by building and using bioinformatics tools. Education: PhD in NeuroScience & Bioinformatics McGill University 2011-2017
B.Sc in Biochemistry University of Ottawa 2006-2010 Programming Skills: Python: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, ggplot2, plotly, sklearn, Keras, jupyter notebooks R: ggplot2, lattice, base R, limma, Genomics Ranges, R markdown notebooks Other languages: Bash, awk , Java, C++ Markdown & styling: HTML, CSS, markdown Version control using git: github, bitbucket (user: rdali) High Performance Computing: Batch, PBS/Torque, Slurm Operating Systems: Mac, Linux, Windows Framework development Software installation and configuration

item.title: Publications
item.description: RobusTAD: A Tool for Robust Annotation of Topologically Associating Domain Boundaries. BiorXiv 2018. Rola Dali, Guillaume Bourque, Mathieu Blanchette Characterization of a FOXG1:TLE1 transcriptional network in glioblastoma-initiating cells. Molecular Oncology 2018. Rola Dali, Federica Verginelli, Albena Pramatarova, Robert Sladek, Stefano Stifani A critical assessment of topologically associating domain prediction tools. Nucleic Acids Research 2017. Rola Dali, Mathieu Blanchette Transcriptional regulation of mouse hypoglossal motor neuron somatotopic map formation.
